aboutMe.part1: Hey, I'm Jess! I'm a 4th year UBC computer science nerd passionate about both
aboutMe.part4: I love finding ways to connect the two and bring creations to life, especially in the areas of web development. If you want to know more about me, keep on scrolling!

education.title: University of British Columbia
education.description: Bachelor of Science, Major in Computer Science

experience.title: iXp Agile Developer Intern
experience.description: Implemented geospatial query optimization that persists queries in a central place for performance gain. Shipped high-priority JavaScript bug fixes and wrote automation to maintain quality.

experience.title: Software Developer Co-op
experience.description: Crushed bugs in PHP, refactored Scala backend code, implemented front-end React features and an endpoint in Go, and led an API migration project for my team’s features.

passions.title: UI/UX Design
passions.description: Something that I really enjoy is the process of owning a project and carefully designing it from scratch.

passions.title: Web Development
passions.description: Then, taking that to the next level and building it in order to bring it to life is a whole new success.

passions.title: Hackathons
passions.description: I absolutely love the ideation, learning, and collaboration that happens during these 24-hour events.

projects.name: Jean Around the World
projects.description: A MERN stack web app integrating Google Places API to recommend trip itineraries based on a set of user preferences. I designed and implemented key features such as user signup/login functionality and exporting to calendar with dynamic result processing.

projects.name: i-prep-you
projects.description: A React web app leveraging facial recognition and speech-to-text APIs to provide real-time feedback-driven interview prep experience based on user performance. I designed and implemented front-end components to retrieve and render back-end data.

projects.name: Personal Website (2019)
projects.description: Old personal website that I built with vanilla HTML/CSS/JavaScript. Features a very basic, responsive, static design as it was my first attempt at building a website. There's a lot of room for improvement since its deployment :')

projects.name: UBC Hackcamp 2020 Design
projects.description: Worked on the UI/UX design for UBC's 2020 beginner-friendly hackathon, Hackcamp. Created vector assets that would generate a sense of community and comfort for attendees in a time of virtual uncertainty.

projects.name: nwHacks 2020 Design
projects.description: Designed for Western Canada's largest hackathon, nwHacks. Workflow and timeline consisted of prototyping, creating, and iterating on the website experience for a hacker audience of hundreds!

projects.name: nwPlus Livesite Design
projects.description: To provide the best streamlined hacker experience for attendees at UBC's hackathons, I helped design a live site platform for handling hackathon day-of stream logistics. The site features a dashboard for watching live presentations, quicklinks, a schedule, as well as judging and submission functionality.

projects.name: Designing cmd-f, Vancouver’s first all-female* hackathon
projects.description: Branding and design direction for a first-iteration hackathon.

projects.name: Inbox: Powering our Front-End through a Data-Driven Model
projects.description: Hootsuite Inbox is a product that allows customers to engage with their audiences through several various social media platforms: all in one consolidated place. To manage such large flows of data, we maintain what we call a data-driven approach that leverages GraphQL queries to communicate with and power our React front-end.
